reviews.text: We were lucky enough to have Rosefield as our base while exploring Bruny Island and the Huon Valley. The guest rooms are separate from the main house and have a tastefully furnished living room (with open fire) and a wonderful rose covered verandah with views down to the water. Sue and Roger were fabulous hosts and the breakfast was a delight. The bathrooms are spacious and extras like real coffee and chocolates are a nice touch. Guests are welcome to explore the grounds and wander through the gardens to the dam to see the geese, sheep and alpacas. Rosefield is located close to the Bruny ferry, Peppermint Bay and a local cheesery. A gorgeous part of the world. This is truly a five star experience - don't stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: The best B & B in Tasmania
Go there and be spoiled
reviews.text: Cannot say enough good things about this b and b. Only recently taking guests and will surely be number 1 in the Kettering area in trip advisor in a short time. Every attention to detail in the furnishings, the little extras in your room, the lovely lounge area and outdoor verandah. Great hosts, reasonable nightly rate, memorable experience. Must be lovely to be sue and Roger and be able to make people so very happy.
Such an amazing place, would have loved to stay longer!
reviews.title: Fantastic view, fantastic room, fantastic hospitality

reviews.text: Sue and Roger are so lovely, such great hosts.
reviews.title: Do yourself a favour

reviews.text: The room and bathroom were beautiful.
reviews.title: Fantastic b&b stay in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rosefield is a beautifully situated property with gorgeous gardens, a beautiful interior, and warm and welcoming hosts. If you're the sociable type, you'll appreciate the great company of the wonderfully friendly hosts, and if you're keen to hang out just with your travel buddy (or buddies) there is plenty of space for privacy.
reviews.title: A great getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guest room my husband and I stayed in had a fantastic bathroom that was apparently recently renovated and is really spacey with a giant shower, big bath and beautiful design. The two guest rooms open up to a spacious but cosy loungeroom with a wood heater and lovely big lounge.
reviews.title: Amazing Bed and Breakfast
